info.name: 8 Colour Dithering
info.description:
I wanted to try converting to 3 bit/8 colour space.
Quite easy in principle, you just round every r, g and b up to 1 or down to 0.
the dithering just varies the threshold for rounding.
2 pixel dithering and 3 pixel use different criteria.

renderpass.name: Image

info.name: 8 Colour Noise-Time Dithering
info.description:
My random noise on the left, and IQ's blue noise suggestion, much better, on the right.
Dithering before gamma on the bottom

renderpass.name: Image

info.name: 8 to 36(27) colour dither.
info.description:
Chequered dither that swaps each frame for almost imperceptible dithering.
There's only 27 distinct colours here though, red/white produces the same RGB as yellow/magenta, for example.
Black/white, red/cyan, green/magenta and blue/yellow - same gray!

info.name: Animandelbrot

my third attempt at a mandelbrot set

this is much nicer, great for exploring the set
I've colored the convergence in as well.
mouse-x scales and mouse-y changes the colour

renderpass.code:
#define AA 1.0 // Anti-aliasing sample count
#define MBLUR 2.5 // Motion blur strength for temporal smoothing
#define MAX_STEPS 150 // Maximum ray marching iterations
#define MAX_DIST 100.0 // Maximum ray marching distance
#define SURF_DIST 0.001 // Surface hit detection threshold
// Texture mapping and displacement parameters
#define UV_SCALE_X 0.4 // Horizontal UV coordinate scaling for iris texture
#define UV_SCALE_Y 0.6 // Vertical UV coordinate scaling for iris texture
#define UV_OFFSET 0.5 // UV coordinate offset to center texture mapping
#define DISPLACE_AMOUNT 0.015 // Amount of surface displacement based on texture darkness
// Flatten parameters
#define FLATTEN_ANGLE 0.8 // Angle at which the eye sphere is flattened (radians)
#define FLATTEN_DEPTH 0.5 // Inner radius of the flattened iris area
#define LIGHTP vec3(1.0,1.0,-0.9) // Light source position in world space

#define REFRACT 1.15 // Lens refraction index (1.0 = no refraction)
// apparenty 1.52 is recommended for eye but is way too much, possibly because geometry

// Light focusing parameters
#define LENS_FOCUS_STRENGTH 6.0 // Intensity multiplier for lens focusing effect
#define LENS_CUTOFF_ANGLE 1.2 // Maximum angle for light to pass through lens (radians)
#define BASE_BRIGHTNESS 1.5 // Overall brightness multiplier for focused lighting

mat3 g_rotation; // Global rotation matrix for eye orientation
float g_lightIntensity = 0.0; // Real-time calculated light intensity hitting iris
float r_lightIntensity = 0.0; // Temporally smoothed light intensity for pupil dilation

// Calculate how much light hits the iris based on eye orientation
float calculateIrisLightIntensity(mat3 rotation) {
    vec3 irisForward = rotation * vec3(0.0, 0.0, -1.0); // Eye's forward direction after rotation
    vec3 lightDir = normalize(LIGHTP); // Normalized light direction
    float intensity = max(0.0, dot(irisForward, lightDir)); // Dot product for light angle
   intensity = pow(intensity,0.3); // Power curve to adjust intensity falloff
    return intensity;
}

// Create cat-eye shaped pupil using signed distance field
float sdCateye(vec2 p, float height, float dilation)
{
    float vrad = height/2.; // Vertical radius of cat eye
    dilation = min(.999, max(0.01, dilation)); // Clamp dilation to valid range
    float rad = (vrad)/dilation; // Circle radius for constructing cat eye shape
    float dist = sqrt((rad*rad)-(vrad*vrad)); // Distance between circle centers
    p = abs(p); // Mirror to work in first quadrant only
    vec2 center = vec2(-dist, 0.); // Center position of construction circle
    float tdist = distance(p, center); // Distance from point to circle center
    float result = tdist - rad; // Basic circle SDF
    vec2 nearest = center+(p-center)*rad/tdist; // Nearest point on circle
    if(nearest.y>vrad){result=distance(p,vec2(0.,vrad));} // Cap the shape vertically
    return result;
}
vec3 contrast(vec3 color, float value) {return 0.5 + value * (color - 0.5);} // Adjust color contrast around middle gray
vec3 gmc(vec3 colour, float gamma) {return pow(colour, vec3(1. / gamma));} // Apply gamma correction to color

// Generate procedural iris texture with cat-eye pupil
vec4 eyeTexture(vec2 uv, float lightDilation) {
    vec2 p = (uv*2.)-1.; // Convert UV to centered coordinates (-1 to 1)
    p.x/=iResolution.y/iResolution.x; // Correct for aspect ratio
    p*=1.3; // Scale the texture coordinates
    float eHeight = 1.; // Base height for cat eye shape
    float eDilation = mix(1.0, 0.15, 1.-lightDilation); // Calculate pupil dilation based on light
    eHeight= 1.0 + eDilation/2.; // Adjust eye height based on dilation
	float dA = sdCateye( p, eHeight, 0.0); // Outer boundary of cat eye
    float dB = sdCateye( p, eHeight, eDilation); // Inner boundary (pupil) of cat eye
    float d = dB-dA; // Distance field for iris region
    if(p.x<0.){d=-d;} // Mirror effect for asymmetry
    float cd = length(p*vec2(.84,1)/1.07); // Distance from center with elliptical scaling
    d = mix(d,0. , min(1.,max(0.,(cd-.8)*5.))); // Blend out displacement at edges
    float eb = distance(p, vec2(0.1, -0.6)); // Distance to eye highlight point 1
    float el = distance(p, vec2(0.3, -1.2)); // Distance to eye highlight point 2
    float et = distance(p, vec2(-.2, 0.6)); // Distance to eye highlight point 3
    float ee = max(et, eb); // Combine highlight distances
    vec3 col = (dB>0.0) ? (texture(iChannel0, (p.xy+vec2(0.2,-0.3)+vec2(d,0))/6., 0.).rgb+0.2)/(0.7+dB): vec3(0); // Sample base texture with displacement
    col = mix(col*col*col, col, min(1.,dB*10.)); // Darken areas closer to pupil
    col = mix(vec3(0), col, min(1.,dB*45.)); // Create sharp pupil edge
    dB = dB*dB; // Square distance for sharper falloff
    col = contrast(col, 1.-(dB/5.)); // Reduce contrast near pupil
    col = gmc(col, 0.4+dB); // Apply gamma correction varying with distance from pupil
    if(col.r<0.1-(dB/max(0.0001,eDilation*1.5))){col=vec3(0);} // Threshold red channel for pupil
    if(col.g<0.1-(dB/max(0.0001,eDilation*1.5))){col=vec3(0);} // Threshold green channel for pupil
    col = mix(col, vec3(0,0,0.1), max(0.,cd-.93 )*7.); // Add blue tint at outer edge
    col.g*=1.5; // Enhance green channel
    col = mix(col, vec3(1,1,1), min(1.,max(0.,cd-1.05 )*15.)); // Add white outer rim
    return vec4(col, 1.);
}

// Signed distance function for the eye sphere with flattened front
float sdEye(vec3 p, float r) {
    float d = length(p) - r; // Basic sphere distance
    float cutDepth = r * cos(FLATTEN_ANGLE); // Depth of the flat cut
    float planeD = -p.z - cutDepth; // Distance to cutting plane
    d = max(d, planeD); // Intersect sphere with plane to flatten front

    float outerRadius = r * sin(FLATTEN_ANGLE); // Radius of flattened circular area
    float innerRadius = FLATTEN_DEPTH; // Inner radius for texture application
    float distFromCenter = length(p.xy); // Distance from center axis in XY plane
    
    // Apply texture-based displacement only on the flattened front surface
    if (p.z <= -cutDepth + 0.1 && distFromCenter <= outerRadius) {
        vec2 uv; // UV coordinates for texture sampling
        uv.x = p.x * UV_SCALE_X + UV_OFFSET; // Calculate U coordinate
        uv.y = p.y * UV_SCALE_Y + UV_OFFSET; // Calculate V coordinate
        uv = clamp(uv, 0.0, 1.0); // Clamp UV to valid range
        
        vec4 texCol = eyeTexture(uv, r_lightIntensity); // Sample eye texture
        float darkness = 1.0 - (texCol.r * 0.299 + texCol.g * 0.587 + texCol.b * 0.114); // Convert to luminance and invert
        
        float falloff = 1.0; // Displacement falloff factor
        if (distFromCenter > innerRadius) {
            falloff = 1.0 - smoothstep(innerRadius, outerRadius, distFromCenter); // Smooth falloff towards edges
        }
        
        float displaceAmount = darkness * DISPLACE_AMOUNT * falloff; // Calculate displacement amount
        d += displaceAmount; // Apply displacement to surface
    }
    
    return d;
}

float sdLens(vec3 p, float r) {return abs(length(p) - r - 0.02) - 0.003; } // Signed distance function for lens (hollow sphere)

// Calculate surface normal for eye using finite differences
vec3 getEyeNormal(vec3 p) {
    float d = sdEye(p, 1.0); // Sample distance at current point
    vec2 e = vec2(0.001, 0); // Small epsilon for finite difference
    
    vec3 n = d - vec3(
        sdEye(p - e.xyy, 1.0), // Sample X offset
        sdEye(p - e.yxy, 1.0), // Sample Y offset
        sdEye(p - e.yyx, 1.0)  // Sample Z offset
    );
    
    return normalize(n); // Return normalized gradient
}

// Calculate surface normal for lens (simplified for sphere)
vec3 getLensNormal(vec3 p) {
    return normalize(p); // For sphere centered at origin, normal is just normalized position
    // keep this in case we need it again
    float d = sdLens(p, 1.0); // Alternative: calculate via finite differences
    vec2 e = vec2(0.001, 0);
    vec3 n = d - vec3(
        sdLens(p - e.xyy, 1.0),
        sdLens(p - e.yxy, 1.0),
        sdLens(p - e.yyx, 1.0)
    );
    return normalize(n);
}

// Ray march to find intersection with eye surface
float rayMarchEye(vec3 ro, vec3 rd) {
    float dO = 0.0; // Total distance traveled
    
    for(int i = 0; i < MAX_STEPS; i++) {
        vec3 p = ro + rd * dO; // Current ray position
        float dS = sdEye(p, 1.0); // Distance to eye surface
        dO += dS; // Step forward by distance to surface
        if(dO > MAX_DIST || abs(dS) < SURF_DIST) break; // Stop if too far or hit surface
    }
    
    return dO; // Return total distance to intersection
}

// Ray march to find intersection with lens surface
float rayMarchLens(vec3 ro, vec3 rd) {
    float dO = 0.0; // Total distance traveled
    
    for(int i = 0; i < MAX_STEPS; i++) {
        vec3 p = ro + rd * dO; // Current ray position
        float dS = sdLens(p, 1.0); // Distance to lens surface
        dO += dS; // Step forward by distance to surface
        if(dO > MAX_DIST || abs(dS) < SURF_DIST) break; // Stop if too far or hit surface
    }
    
    return dO; // Return total distance to intersection
}

// Get texture color for a point on the eye surface
vec3 getTextureColor(vec3 p) {
    if (p.z < 0.0) { // Only apply texture to front-facing surface
        vec2 uv; // UV coordinates for texture sampling
        uv.x = p.x * UV_SCALE_X + UV_OFFSET; // Calculate U coordinate
        uv.y = p.y * UV_SCALE_Y + UV_OFFSET; // Calculate V coordinate
        uv = clamp(uv, 0.0, 1.0); // Clamp UV to valid range
        
        return eyeTexture(uv, r_lightIntensity).rgb; // Return eye texture color
    }
    return vec3(1.0); // Return white for back surface
}

// Calculate focused light intensity for iris - simulates lens focusing effect like a torch beam at angle
float calculateLensFocusedLight(vec3 irisPoint, vec3 lightPos) {
    vec3 eyeForward = vec3(0.0, 0.0, -1.0); // Eye's forward direction (looking along -Z)
    
    vec3 lightDir = normalize(lightPos); // Normalized light direction from origin
    
    float lightAngle = acos(clamp(dot(eyeForward, lightDir), -1.0, 1.0)); // Angle between eye forward and light
    
    // Cut off light if angle is too large - with smooth transition
    if (lightAngle > LENS_CUTOFF_ANGLE) {
        return 0.0; // No light beyond cutoff angle
    }
    
    float angleFade = 1.0 - smoothstep(LENS_CUTOFF_ANGLE * 0.8, LENS_CUTOFF_ANGLE, lightAngle); // Smooth fadeout near cutoff
    
    float normalizedAngle = lightAngle / LENS_CUTOFF_ANGLE; // Normalize angle to 0-1 range
    
    // Calculate where the focused light beam hits the iris
    vec2 beamCenter = -lightDir.xy * normalizedAngle * 0.5; // Beam center moves opposite to light direction
    
    vec2 irisPos2D = irisPoint.xy; // Project iris point to XY plane
    vec2 toBeam = irisPos2D - beamCenter; // Vector from beam center to iris point
    
    float na2 = pow(normalizedAngle, 3.0); // Cubed angle for stronger effect at high angles
    float stretch = 1.0 + normalizedAngle * 3.0; // Beam elongation factor increases with angle
    float beamWidth = 0.4 * (1.0 - na2 * 0.7); // Beam width decreases with angle (more focused)
    
    vec2 lightDir2D = normalize(lightDir.xy + vec2(0.001)); // Light direction in XY plane (avoid division by zero)
    vec2 perpDir = vec2(-lightDir2D.y, lightDir2D.x); // Perpendicular direction for elliptical stretching
    
    float alongLight = dot(toBeam, lightDir2D) / stretch; // Distance along light direction (compressed by stretch)
    float perpToLight = dot(toBeam, perpDir); // Distance perpendicular to light direction
    
    float distToBeamAxis = sqrt(alongLight * alongLight + perpToLight * perpToLight); // Distance from beam axis
    
    float beamIntensity = exp(-distToBeamAxis * distToBeamAxis / (beamWidth * beamWidth)); // Gaussian falloff for focused beam
    
    float focusMultiplier = 1.0 + normalizedAngle * LENS_FOCUS_STRENGTH; // Intensity multiplier increases with angle
    
    // Smooth blend between uniform and focused lighting based on angle
    float focusAmount = smoothstep(0.0, 0.3, normalizedAngle); // Transition from uniform to focused lighting
    float uniformLighting = 1.0 + normalizedAngle * LENS_FOCUS_STRENGTH * 0.2;  // Uniform lighting with slight boost
    float focusedLighting = beamIntensity * focusMultiplier; // Focused beam lighting
    
    float finalIntensity = mix(uniformLighting, focusedLighting, focusAmount); // Blend between lighting modes
    
    return finalIntensity * angleFade * BASE_BRIGHTNESS; // Apply fadeout and base brightness
}

// Calculate lighting for eye surface with lens focusing effects
vec3 getEyeLight(vec3 p, vec3 rd) {
    vec3 lightInEyeSpace = g_rotation * LIGHTP; // Transform light position to eye space
    vec3 l = normalize(lightInEyeSpace - p); // Light direction from surface point
    vec3 n = getEyeNormal(p); // Surface normal at point
    vec3 v = -rd; // View direction (opposite of ray direction)
    vec3 r = reflect(-l, n); // Reflection direction for specular
    vec3 albedo = getTextureColor(p); // Base color from texture
    
    float dif = clamp(dot(n, l), 0.0, 1.0); // Lambertian diffuse factor
    
    float cutDepth = cos(FLATTEN_ANGLE); // Depth of flattened area
    float outerRadius = sin(FLATTEN_ANGLE); // Radius of flattened area
    bool isIris = p.z <= -cutDepth + 0.1 && length(p.xy) <= outerRadius; // Check if point is on iris
    
    // Apply lens focusing effect only to iris
    if (isIris) {
        float lensFocus = calculateLensFocusedLight(p, lightInEyeSpace); // Get lens focusing multiplier
        dif *= lensFocus; // Apply focusing to diffuse lighting
    }
    
    float spec = pow(max(dot(r, v), 0.0), 16.0); // Phong specular highlight
    vec3 ambient = albedo * 0.15; // Ambient lighting component
    vec3 diffuse = albedo * dif * 0.5; // Diffuse lighting component
    vec3 specular = vec3(1.0) * spec * albedo.g * albedo.r *albedo.b; // Specular component modulated by albedo
    
    return ambient + diffuse + specular; // Combine all lighting components
}

// Calculate lighting for lens surface (glass-like material)
vec3 getLensLight(vec3 p, vec3 rd) {
    vec3 lightInEyeSpace = g_rotation * LIGHTP; // Transform light position to eye space

    vec3 l = normalize(lightInEyeSpace - p); // Light direction from surface point
    vec3 n = getLensNormal(p); // Lens surface normal
    vec3 v = -rd; // View direction
    vec3 r = reflect(-l, n); // Reflection direction
    float spec = pow(max(dot(r, v), 0.0), 32.0); // Sharp specular highlight for glass
    float fresnel = pow(1.0 - abs(dot(v, n)), 1.0); // Fresnel effect for glass edges
    vec3 lensColor = vec3(0.95, 0.97, 1.0); // Slightly blue-tinted glass color
    vec3 baseGlass = lensColor * 0.2; // Base glass transparency
    vec3 specular = vec3(1.) * spec * 50.0; // Bright specular highlight
    vec3 fresnelColor = lensColor * fresnel *0.2; // Fresnel rim lighting
    
    return baseGlass + specular + fresnelColor; // Combine glass lighting components
}

// Refraction using Snell's law - calculates refracted ray direction
vec3 refract_ray(vec3 incident, vec3 normal, float eta) {
    float cosI = -dot(normal, incident); // Cosine of incident angle
    float sinT2 = eta * eta * (1.0 - cosI * cosI); // Sine squared of transmitted angle
    if (sinT2 > 1.0) return vec3(0.0); // Total internal reflection check
    float cosT = sqrt(1.0 - sinT2); // Cosine of transmitted angle
    return eta * incident + (eta * cosI - cosT) * normal; // Snell's law refraction formula
}

// Main rendering function with lens refraction effects
vec4 renderWithRefraction(vec3 ro, vec3 rd) {
    vec3 col = vec3(0.04, 0.04, 0.05); // Background color
    float nearestD = MAX_DIST; // Track nearest intersection distance
    float lensD = rayMarchLens(ro, rd); // Ray march to find lens intersection
    nearestD = min(nearestD, lensD); // Update nearest distance
    if(lensD < MAX_DIST) { // If we hit the lens
        vec3 lensP = ro + rd * lensD; // Lens intersection point
        vec3 lensN = getLensNormal(lensP); // Lens surface normal
        
        float eta = 1.0 / REFRACT; // Refraction ratio (air to glass)
        vec3 refractedRay = refract_ray(rd, lensN, eta); // Calculate refracted ray
        
        if(length(refractedRay) > 0.0) { // If refraction succeeded (no total internal reflection)
            vec3 newRo = lensP + refractedRay * 0.01; // New ray origin inside lens (small offset)
            float eyeD = rayMarchEye(newRo, refractedRay); // Ray march to eye with refracted ray
            
            if(eyeD < MAX_DIST) { // If refracted ray hits eye
                vec3 eyeP = newRo + refractedRay * eyeD; // Eye intersection point
                vec3 eyeCol = getEyeLight(eyeP, refractedRay); // Calculate eye lighting
                
                float refractionStrength = length(rd - refractedRay); // Measure refraction amount
                eyeCol = mix(eyeCol, eyeCol.gbr, refractionStrength * 0.1); // Chromatic aberration effect
                
                col = eyeCol; // Use eye color as final color
            }
        }
        
        vec3 lensCol = getLensLight(lensP, rd); // Calculate lens surface lighting
        float fresnel = pow(1.0 - abs(dot(-rd, lensN)), 2.); // Fresnel factor for lens surface
        col = mix(col, lensCol, fresnel * 0.2); // Blend lens surface effects
        
    } else {
        float eyeD = rayMarchEye(ro, rd); // Direct ray march to eye (no lens)
        nearestD = min(nearestD, eyeD); // Update nearest distance
        if(eyeD < MAX_DIST) { // If ray hits eye directly
            vec3 eyeP = ro + rd * eyeD; // Eye intersection point
            col = getEyeLight(eyeP, rd); // Calculate direct eye lighting
        }
    }
    
    return vec4(col, nearestD); // Return color and distance
}

// Main shader function with eye movement and temporal effects
void mainMS(out vec4 fragColor, in vec2 fragCoord) {
    vec2 uv = (fragCoord - 0.5 * iResolution.xy) / iResolution.y; // Normalized screen coordinates
    vec2 m = vec2(0.5); // Base eye orientation (centered)
    
    vec2 pa = vec2 (sin (floor( iTime ) * 57.678)/10., sin (floor( iTime ) * 97.678)/10.); // Eye position A (pseudorandom)
    vec2 pb = vec2 (sin (floor( iTime+1. ) * 57.678)/10., sin (floor( iTime+1. ) * 97.678)/10.); // Eye position B (next second)
    
    vec2 pm = mix (pa, pb, pow( (  max(0.,fract(iTime)-0.9)  *10.), 4.)); // Smooth interpolation with quick saccade motion
    
    m+= pm; // Add procedural eye movement to base position
    
    if(iMouse.z>0.001){m = iMouse.xy / iResolution.xy;} // Override with mouse control if clicked
    
    vec3 ro = vec3(0, 0, -3); // Ray origin (camera position)
    vec3 rd = normalize(vec3(uv.x, uv.y, 1)); // Ray direction from camera through pixel
    
    float angleY = (m.x - 0.5) * -6.28; // Horizontal rotation angle from mouse/movement
    float angleX = (m.y - 0.5) * 3.14; // Vertical rotation angle from mouse/movement
    
    mat3 rotY = mat3( // Y-axis rotation matrix
        cos(angleY), 0, sin(angleY),
        0, 1, 0,
        -sin(angleY), 0, cos(angleY)
    );
    
    mat3 rotX = mat3( // X-axis rotation matrix
        1, 0, 0,
        0, cos(angleX), -sin(angleX),
        0, sin(angleX), cos(angleX)
    );
    
    g_rotation = rotY * rotX; // Combine rotations
    
    g_lightIntensity = calculateIrisLightIntensity(g_rotation); // Calculate current light intensity on iris
    
    ro = g_rotation * ro; // Apply eye rotation to camera
    rd = g_rotation * rd; // Apply eye rotation to ray direction
    
    vec4 colPND = renderWithRefraction(ro, rd); // Render the scene
    vec3 col = colPND.rgb; // Extract color

    float nearestD = colPND.a; // Extract nearest distance
    if(nearestD < MAX_DIST) {
        col = mix(col, vec3(0.1, 0.1, 0.15), 1.0 - exp(-0.0005 * nearestD * nearestD)); // Apply distance fog
    }
    
   col = pow(col, vec3(0.4545)); // Apply gamma correction
    
    float getli = texture(iChannel1, vec2(0), 0.).r; // Read previous light intensity from buffer
    r_lightIntensity = (g_lightIntensity+getli+getli)/3.; // Temporal smoothing of light intensity
    
    if(fragCoord.x<2. && fragCoord.y<2.) {col.r = r_lightIntensity;} // Store light intensity in buffer (top-left pixel)
    fragColor = (texture(iChannel1, fragCoord/iResolution.xy, 0.)*MBLUR + vec4(col, 1.0))/(1.+MBLUR); // Apply motion blur/temporal smoothing
}

// Anti-aliasing wrapper function using multiple samples per pixel
void mainImage(out vec4 o, vec2 u) 
{ 
    float s = AA, k; // Sample count and counter
    vec2 j = vec2(.5); // Jitter offset for sampling
    o = vec4(0); // Initialize output
    vec4 c; // Color sample
    mainMS(c, u); // Render main sample
    for (k = s; k-- > .5; ) { // Loop for additional AA samples
        mainMS(c, u + j - .5); // Render with jittered position
        o += c; // Accumulate samples
        j = fract(j + vec2(.755, .57).yx); // Update jitter with low-discrepancy sequence
    };o /= s;o.a=1.; // Average samples and set alpha to 1
}

info.name: Picture evolver v1
info.description:
After seeing a video by the guy that made picbreeder, I decided to put this together.
This is very rudimentary and is just a proof of concept - I wanted to get the interactivity and state figured out first.
Only 12 options and no parameters atm.

renderpass.code:
// See comments for instructions, video and link

/*
Instructions:
The small thumbnails are the different options for mutating the image, click on one to transform the image and see the next set of choices.
It goes on forever.
Background
The idea is simple, an evolving image with user selected mutation, with the user picking each iteration based on how interesting they think the image is.
(As opposed to my other attempts at random images that applied a series of transformations automatically based on a random seed,
this felt like a great way to follow that up) The current steps are very limited,
I just wanted to get the basic interaction working and see if it was as fun as it sounded before creating a balanced and varied selection of mutations.
References
This is the picbreeder site https://nbenko1.github.io/#/
They're doing this but at scale, with a user base, and collaborative evolution of pictures, gallery etc.
I think they're using the process of selecting interesting images to train AI as well.
And this is the interview that prompted me to try this out
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5zg_5hg8Ydo&t=778s
*/

void mainImage( out vec4 fragColor, in vec2 fragCoord )
{
   fragColor = texture(iChannel0, fragCoord/iResolution.xy, 0.);
}

info.name: Polyhedra by sphere intersection
info.description:
Using intersection of spheres to draw a dodecahedron.
We can make the spheres bigger for more precision.
Has the advantage that no faces are defined, just the points of the dual - so using icosahdreon points gives us a dodecahedron.

renderpass.code:
#define mainImage mainImage0(out vec4 O, vec2 U); \
void mainImage(out vec4 o, vec2 u) \
{ \
    float s =3., k; \
    vec2 j = vec2(.5); \
    o = vec4(0); \
    vec4 c; \
    mainImage0(c, u); \
    for (k = s; k-- > .5; ) { \
        mainImage0(c, u + j - .5); \
        o += c; \
        j = fract(j + vec2(.754877669, .569840296).yx); \
        \
    };o /= s;o.a==1.;\
    \
} \
void mainImage0

info.name: Random image pixel sort
info.description:
Instructions:
Drag the canvas until you see an image you like, let go and watch the pixel sorting happen.
Scrub across canvas again to see result and derivative, let go to see height map.
Rewind to try again with new image

renderpass.code:
/* Fork of "Parallel Linear Assignment Sort" by michael0884. https://shadertoy.com/view/wfK3Rw
   Fork of "Random Feedback Shader" by Cotterzz. https://shadertoy.com/view/wft3Dr
   2025-05-23 08:51:41
---
Instructions:
Drag the canvas until you see an image you like, let go and watch the pixel sorting happen.
Scrub across canvas again to see result and derivative, let go to see height map.
Rewind to try again with new image
---
This was two shaders thrown together quite quickly, so the code is a mess, and a bit slow at high res.
I need to turn the image generation into an easy to use function, plus the whole thing could be optimised a lot
---
I loved the unpredictable but deterministic results of michael0884's pixel sort shader,
So I used my random image genearator as input to explore different images.
The result feels very random & truly generative.
*/
void mainImage( out vec4 fragColor, in vec2 fragCoord )
{
   fragColor = texture(iChannel0, fragCoord/iResolution.xy, 0.);
}

info.name: Randomised, subdivided KIFS
info.description:
the KIFS fractals are randomised.
But the iterations, inc folds and transforms, are also randomised.
This produces more interesting shapes reminiscent of spaceships.
See more here: [url]https://www.sleditor.com/#id=a7zasp0vl[/url]

info.name: SDF Editor Spider
info.description:
I'm using three axes of symmetry here to turn one leg into eight.
Made with a node based SDF tree editor I'm working on.
Currently it's standalone and has shadertoy glsl export, but I will integrate it with sleditor at some point.
(This took 10 min)

click on the canvas to draw points.

info.name: Sphere warping
info.description: By changing the centre or radius depending on uv position we can create some really interesting effects, pity that it's not possible to translate it to 3D, afaik...

renderpass.name: Image

info.name: Spheroid - game renderer.
info.description:
Main shader for a game I'm developing.
No SDFs, raymarching etc were used, just sphere intersection and making up the 3D/lighting as I went along, with hand coded AA for each shape.
Not how I'd do it now, but still it's quite performant.

renderpass.name: Image
Common

info.name: Spider + sleditor #slai
info.description:
This is the previous shader imported to sleditor, and transformed using the #slai command
It's not a magic bullet, wont perform miracles and still needs an experienced developer to guide it .
But these two tools in combination will save a lot of time.

renderpass.name: Image

info.name: Temporal pixel dither v1
info.description:
Tracks the RGB channels of each pixel over time and assign one of the limited palette colours, so the average RGB output is the same
Left is temporal only, right is spatial and temporal
Click to round up and prevent near white/black flashing.

info.name: Titaniumballz
info.description:
This is a GLSL renderer for a game I'm developing in C, Raylib and JS

There are still a few more features to add before it's ready to plug into the game.
Right now I need to spend some time tidying up the code and optimising.

renderpass.name: Image

info.name: Titaniumballz 2
info.description:
Second attempt at this, from https://www.shadertoy.com/view/4fByD1

Some improvements and a more realistic lighting model, with some gamma and contrast/tone adjustments via the mouse.

Feedback welcome, there's still room for improvement.
